message_1: Evaluate the limit of the function f(x)= (x^2 - 4x + 3)/(x - 3), as x approaches 3.
message_2:
To evaluate the limit of the function f(x) = (x^2 - 4x + 3)/(x - 3) as x approaches 3, we first try to simplify the function.

We can factor the numerator:

x^2 - 4x + 3 = (x - 1)(x - 3)

So, the function can be rewritten as:

f(x) = ((x - 1)(x - 3))/(x - 3)

Now, we can cancel out the (x - 3) terms in the numerator and denominator:

f(x) = x - 1

Now that the function is simplified, we can find the limit as x approaches 3:

lim (x -> 3) (x - 1) = 3 - 1 = 2

So, the limit of the function f(x) as x approaches 3 is 2.
